revised_title: Observations of the Sun's and Moon's Eclipses in 1748
tldr: John Bevis observed the solar eclipse of July 14, 1748, and the lunar eclipse of July 28, 1748, using the twelve-foot refracting telescope and the great twelve-foot reflector. He recorded the details of the observations, including the times and phases of the eclipses, and discussed the challenges faced due to weather conditions.
